item.title: China Woos Africa, Casting Itself as Global South’s Defender
item.description: More than 50 African leaders have gathered in Beijing for a summit aimed at projecting the influence of China’s leader, Xi Jinping, in the developing world.

item.description:
1. Harris campaign agrees to muted mics in debate against Trump  CBS News
  2. Harris Proposes New Tax Plan as Trump Hits Campaign Trail: Election Live Updates  The New York Times

  5. Harris relents on muting mics  POLITICO

item.title: HL: 'Will not leave Gaza border until ...': Netanyahu sets conditions for permanent ceasefire
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Israel will not vacate the Gaza border corridor until there are guarantees against its use by Hamas for smuggling weapons. He stressed the need for consistent prevention measures. The US is formulating a new ceasefire proposal, but Hamas has rejected all aspects of it so far.

item.title: Trump says his debate strategy is to give Harris room to speak
item.description: Donald Trump has announced he will let Kamala Harris speak without interruption during their upcoming presidential debate. This shift comes as the candidates prepare for a crucial face-off hosted by ABC News in Philadelphia. Both campaigns have clashed over microphone rules, with the debate being pivotal for swaying Pennsylvania's swing state voters.

item.title: US elections 2024: Trump and Harris neck-and-neck in key battleground states, new poll shows
item.description: A recent survey indicates a close contest between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris in critical battleground states. Both candidates are tied at 47% support in Pennsylvania, while Harris narrowly leads Trump 48%-47% in Georgia. The poll also shows Harris ahead in Michigan and Wisconsin, with Trump leading in Arizona. The upcoming debate could be decisive.

item.title: Trump lobs same insults at Harris and Walz in Pennsylvania town hall
item.description:
Ex-president repeats false claims to Sean Hannity of asylum seekers and crime and says: ‘We’re going to heal our world’

Donald Trump lobbed his usual insults and accusations at Kamala Harris and Tim Walz during a town hall aired on Fox News and then falsely claimed that migrants from around the world are pouring into the US.

The pre-taped interview aired Wednesday evening. The former president walked onto the stage in a Pennsylvania arena to cheers, applause and chants of “USA” from his supporters.

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump appears in town hall hosted by Sean Hannity – as it happened
item.description:
This blog is now closed. Here is our full story on US conservative influencers saying they are ‘victims’ of a Russian disinformation campaign.

Half of gen-Z voters said they will vote for Kamala Harris in November, according to a new NBC News poll published today.

The poll shows one-third of gen-Z voters said they plan to vote for Donald Trump, and 1 in 10 said they do not plan to vote in the presidential election.

Continue reading...
